Uses of DistanceFunction in com.jgaap.distances
 

Subclasses of DistanceFunction in com.jgaap.distances
 class CamberraDistance
          Camberra distance, defined as D(x,y) = sum (| (xi -yi)/(xi + yi) |).
 class CosineDistance
          Cosine Distance or normalized dot product.
 class CrossEnt
          Cross-entropy "divergence" for Nearest Neighbor.
 class HistogramDistance
          Histogram distance using L2 metric,(defined as D(x,y) = sum ((xi -yi)^2) This is YA distance for Nearest Neighbor algorithms
 class KendallCorrelationDistance
          Deprecated. 
 class KullbackLeiblerDistance
          Kullback-Leibler divergence, to be treated as YA distance for nearest-neighbor algorithms.
 class LevenshteinDistance
          LevenshteinDistance, the edit-distance between two sequences of Events.
 class LZWDistance
          LZWDistance, : conditional LZW distance, basically LZW(ab)-LZW(b).
 class ManhattanDistance
          Histogram distance using L1 metric,(defined as D(x,y) = sum (|xi -yi|).
 class NominalKSDistance
          Nominal Kolmogorov-Smirnov distance for Nearest Neighbor algorithm
 class Xent2
